item.title: Report E-2025040573
item.description:
Report E-2025040573

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: CARTERET
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon walking the dock, one of the supervisors noticed a small battery had fallen on its side on the pallet it was shipped on. This led to a minor spillage of fluid from the battery on to the dock. The fluid on the dock was neutralized and cleaned up with sorbents. The battery and clean up materials were placed into separate overpacks and prepared for dispostion.

item.title: Report E-2025040574
item.description:
Report E-2025040574

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: CARTERET
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: As the jerrican were being unloaded the unloader noticed one of the jerrican was leaking. The pallet they were shipped on had cardboard dunnage on it for protection, but a loose nail protruding from the pallet poked through and punctured the jerrican. Once the leak was noticed, leadership was immediately notified. HAZWOPER trained personnel flipped the jerrican over to stop the leak. 3b putty was placed on the jerrican and allowed to cure. Once cured, the pail was placed in an overpack drum in preparation for disposition.
